title: Basic html color input test
description: A basic html color input test.

chrome.notes: button was not conveyed at all

chrome.output: previous input was announced, not the color picker button
not in list of form controls
focus was sent back to the previous control
Not possible to open the control

edge.notes: button was not conveyed at all

edge.output: previous input was announced, not the color picker button
not in list of form controls
focus was sent back to the previous control
Not possible to open the control

ie.output: "edit, number e66465, your favorite color, edit, number e66465, type in text"
"Your favorite color?, edit, number e66465, type in text"
in list of form fields as "Your favorite color? edit, #e66465"

firefox.output: "your favorite color, button, to activate press space bar"
in list of form controls as "your favorite color, button"
input was announced without the new value

results.notes: pressed enter on the okay button within the widget dialog after selecting a new color.

firefox.output: No keyboard commands worked until I used alt+tab to refocus the browser. It was possible to navigate around the dialog using the tab and arrow keys, but buttons to select colors were missing names. It was possible to navigate around the dialog using the tab and arrow keys, but buttons to select colors were missing names.

edge.output: "your favorite color? color picker, 90% red 39% red, 39% blue, scan"
"your favorite color? color picker, 90% red 39% red, 39% blue, scan"
"your favorite color? color picker, 90% red 39% red, 39% blue, scan"
earcon was announced after clicking the accept button, but new value was not conveyed.

results.notes: partial because the new color was conveyed via the 'output' in the color picker just before the accept button.

edge.output: most semantics were correctly conveyed, however the value of the sliders was never conveyed.

chrome.output: not in list of form controls

New value was announced ("90% red 39% green 69% blue
")

results.notes: pressed enter on the okay button within the widget dialog after selecting a new color.

chrome.output: color picker was opened but there was no announcement. Contents of the picker were mostly accessible. Interacting with the format toggler often crashed the browser.

edge.output: not in list of form controls

New value was announced ("90% red 39% green 69% blue
")

results.notes: pressed enter on the okay button within the widget dialog after selecting a new color.

edge.output: color picker was opened but there was no announcement. Contents of the picker were mostly accessible. Interacting with the format toggler often crashed the browser.

firefox.output: "clickable, your favorite color? button, Your favorite color?"
in list of form fields as "your favorite color, button"
title of the document was announced after clicking okay

results.notes: pressed enter on the okay button within the widget dialog after selecting a new color.

firefox.output: No keyboard commands worked until I used alt+tab to refocus the browser. It was possible to navigate around the dialog using the tab and arrow keys, but buttons to select colors were missing names.

and_chr.output: "#e66465, color picker, double tap to change"
"#e66465, color picker, double tap to change"

results.notes: activated the button to set the value within the widget dialog after selecting a new color.

and_chr.output: was able to open, navigate, and select a value.

results.notes: some elements were missing appropriate semantics. For example, the color buttons were not conveyed as buttons and the slider controls were missing names.

and_chr.output: input was flagged with a number
was able to select and set a color using commands like "tap <name>" and "tap <number>"

ios_saf.output: input was announced with the new value
was able to select and set a color. appropriate semantics were conveyed.

safari.output: "indian red 2, your favorite color? color well"
"indian red 2, your favorite color? color well"
in list of form controls as "indian red 2, your favorite color? color well"
color picker was closed and re-opened, and focus was sent back to the top of the widget

results.notes: pressed enter on a color button within the widget.

safari.output: was able to navigate and select a color within the widget. However, after choosing a color, the widget was closed, re-opened, and focus was sent to the top of the widget.

firefox.output: input was announced without the new value

results.notes: activated the button to set the value within the widget after selecting a new color.

firefox.output: It is possible to navigate and change the value of the color, however some information is not conveyed. For example, it is possible to change the value within the ring and triangle, but changes in value are not automatically announced.

ios_saf.output: was able to operate the widget and select a value using commands like "tap <number>" and "tap <name>"

safari.output: input was not flagged with a number
unable to open or operate the widget

chrome.output: input was flagged with a number
unable to use any commands within the color picker

history.message: Added Narrator results for NVDA and JAWS, updated NVDA+Chrome results.
